page.title: 13THE GREAT WESTERN SOCIETY
page.content: Where the new car park is, to the West of the BR Station, there used to stand, until 1976, the Provender Store. This stored hay and grain for the 3,000 horses which used to work on the railway. Brunel's 7'1/4" broad gauge track is an historical piece of track which members of the GWS have laid. All the GWR engines were coloured and lettered according to their route and group. For example the Manor's route colour was blue and its group letter was D. As you travel up the line from Reading to Didcot, you pass some empty ground near the track, where the spur sidings used to be. Since the GWS's two sheds were re-opened in 1970 the Society has gone from strength to strength, attracting not only national but world-wide support.
